then I guess you would have to manually edit the /etc/init.d/<service> script... I dont think you can do it another way. For inspiration the init script that comes with openafs-client does exactly that: "start" does nothing, you have to manually start it with "force-start"
dpkg -S <pkg> if the package is installed, or apt-cache search <pkg> to get info on packages that may not be installed
